ngoList.address: Swaramurthy V N Rao Memorial Trust No.4 Ellappa Garden 10th Cross Malleshwaram Bangalore 560003
ngoList.title: Swaramurthy V N Rao Memorial Trust
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Aim and Activities of the Trust:- Veene Seshanna was the principal architect of â€œMysore Baniâ€ (Mysore School of Veena). His grandson Swaramurthy V N Rao was a great Veena Player, Vocalist & Guru. To perpetuate their memory our trust conducts Music Festivals, Music Competitions, Presentations of Awards, Publication of Books and CDs and Conducts Music Workshops. Awards:- Every year the trust presents 2 awards: 1. Instrumental Award to a veteran instrumentalist of Carnatic Music 2. Vocal Award to a senior Vocalist of Carnatic Music. We present a purse of Rs.50,000/- with other paraphernalia for each awardee. Music Festival:- We conduct every year a music festival called VEENEYA BEDAGU â€“ both in & outside Karnataka. The festival consists of not only Veena concerts but also Vocal & other instrumental music performances. Sufficient opportunities will be provided to young & talented artists. Its also our aim to propagate compositions of Mysore Composers â€“ in particular Veene Seshanna & Swaramurthy V N Raoâ€™s compositions. The trustâ€™s aim is also to educate the listeners and convert them in to connoisseurs. For this purpose we also conduct academic sessions, wherein lecture, demonstrations on various subjects will be conducted by eminent scholars and musicologists of the country. Specially a detailed study of compositions of Veene Seshanna in both Vocal and Instrument, focusing on Raga, Thala and Lyrics. These academic sessions will be in both music and dance. Workshops:- To propagate the compositions of Veene Seshanna, workshops will be conducted in both Music and Dance, both in and outside Karnataka. This will helps young artists to learn Seshannaâ€™s compositions in an authentic way and the compositions will flow from generation to generation. CDs:- To spread Seshannaâ€™s compositions in an authentic way the trust plans to bring these compositions in the form of CDs in an authentic way. Based on the authentic â€œVarnamattuâ€ eminent musicians will perform in both vocal and instrument and give a reliable version. Publication :- The trust is planning to publish books on various subjects of Music. Especially compositions of Seshanna to be published in different languages of India with reliable SWARAPRASTHARA and precise SAHITHYA. It is also proposing to bring Seshannaâ€™s compositions in English(with Carnatic Music Notations). The trustâ€™s ambitious project is to publish a magnum opus on Veene Seshanna â€“ i.e., an international edition. It is also proposed to publish books on Veena, Contemporary Veena Players of Seshanna, Veena Players of the Mysore Palace, Vainikaâ€™s of different BAANEEâ€™S and anything on music. Documentation:- To scout, survey and collect musical instruments and any other materials connected with music and musicians and photographs of both our past and present musicians. To build an ARCHIVES of historical value, to organize exhibition of photographs, instruments, testimonials of our past and present musicians and give a visual effect to music! In a nutshell our trustâ€™s aim to serve the classical music field in all the possible ways.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Swasti is a health resource centre working in the area of HIV and AIDS. It seeks to advance health and well-being of communities it works with by mobilising them to better address healthcare priorities; improving the efficiency and effectiveness of organisations in the health sector; combining sector knowledge with gender, equity, vulnerability and anti-poverty perspectives and management skills. Swasti has been successfully running project Pragati, an empowerment initiative for women in sex work, covering over 16000 women in Bangalore city of Karnataka. It is engaged in a Rural Intervention Project working in 100 high priority villages of 5 talukas in Chickballapur and Kolar districts of Karnataka focusing on women in sex work. It supports a network of three community based organisations of women in sex work implement a project addressing stigma and discrimination of PLHIV. It is also running a learning systems project for HIV targeted and care and support interventions in Karnataka. Through technical and management support Swasti has worked with district, state and the central government departments in planning and reviews. Swasti wrote the Round 7, 8 and 9 proposal for the Global Fund on behalf of the India CCM. The Round 7 proposal was awarded to India. It has conducted functional reviews of state health departments of Orissa, Andhra Pradesh and Madhya Pradesh. It has conducted three rounds of State Project Directorâ€™s Induction Programme in collaboration with NACO and UNAIDS. It has conducted mapping of high risk activities in 436 urban towns of 4 states and 9700 rural areas in 85 districts of 26 states of India. It is the Zonal Agency in the South for concurrent evaluation of National Rural Health Mission â€“ 2008. It is engaged in the impact evaluation of the Balasahayoga program (comprehensive HIV care and support program for infected and affected children) in Andhra Pradesh, India. It has also supported international agencies, including UNAIDS, UNODC, Govt. of Phillipines and Maldives, Save the Children UK, on various proposal development and monitoring and evaluation assignments. Apart from this it has also worked with numerous national agencies in providing technical and management support. Swasti seeks to contribute to the health sector through sharing of its experiences and learnings, networking with agencies working in health and participating in policy forums. Swasti has participated in NACOâ€™s technical committee on female condoms, mapping and mainstreaming HIV. It has developed resources (training modules, case study compendiums, films, audio-visual CDs) on topics related to empowerment of women in sex work, care and support and personal advancement and career enhancement of female garment workers. It provides training to different organisations â€“ public and private on different aspects of HIV. It supports organisational development initiatives of Arunodaya Network of HIV+ people. It has also put together a repository of HIV and Health systems related documents and research studies.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: 1.The Akshaya Patra Foundation is a not-for-profit organization headquartered in Bengaluru, India. 2.Our organization strives to fight issues like hunger and malnutrition in India, by implementing the Mid-Day Meal Scheme in the government schools and government-aided schools in partnership with State Governments, which provides support in the form of Free Grain Grant and cash conversion cost on per meal basis. 3.Since 2001, the organization has worked towards reaching more children with wholesome food on every single school day, with a small beginning of 1500 children 4.Today Akshaya Patra is the worldâ€™s largest (not-for-profit run) mid-day meal programme serving wholesome food to around 1.6 million children from 13,529 schools across 11 states in India. 5.With the vision of â€œNo child in India shall be deprived of education because of hungerâ€, the foundation aims to reach out to 5 million children by 2020. Pioneering a technology-driven operating model, this programme has been a success in terms of its reach-out, scalability and replicability. 6.Eleven of Akshaya Patraâ€™s kitchens have been ISO 22000:2005 certified which ensures highest level of cleanliness and hygiene standards. 7.Akshaya Patra is continuously leveraging technology to cater to millions of children. Its state-of-the-art kitchens have become a subject of study and they attract curious visitors from around the world. 8.Akhaya Patra has won many awards & accolades as per below : i. ICAI Gold Shield Award for the 5th consecutive year for excellence in Financial Reporting ii. Akshaya Patra enters ICAIâ€™s prestigious â€˜Hall of Fameâ€™, the only NGO until now. iii. Akshaya Patra featured in a nine episode CNN-IBN television series, â€˜Innovating for a Better Tomorrowâ€™, which showcased innovations with significant business and social impact, 2014 iv. Ranked 23rd among the Top 100 NGOs by The Global Journal in its 2013 edition v. Akshaya Patra nominated to be Member of National Steering-cum-Monitoring Committee for Mid-Day Meal Programme. vi. Featured as one of the 8 Indian game changers in the inaugural issue of Innowin-Indiaâ€™s first magazine dedicated to innovation. vii. LASSIB Society â€“ Honorary Award on Social Responsibility viii. Marico Innovation Foundation Award 2012 ix. Akshaya Patra Jaipur Wins Community Leadership Award 2012 x. Received invitation to attend International Congress entitled â€˜Rural Woman, Partner of the Development Processâ€™ held in Rabat, Morocco, 2012. xi. The Leap Vault Change Leadership awards 2010 xii. Indian Express Innovation Award 2010 xiii. Best Innovative Project by India Urban Space Foundation xiv. The worlds largest school meal program Limca Book of Records xv. Lifebuoy National Child Health Award 2009 xvi. Harvard Business School develops a case study for its MBA curriculum on Akshaya Patra. xvii. Microsoft Tech Museum Award (Education Category) 2009 xviii. World Economic Forum invited Akshaya Patra to share its experiences for THE PROJECT HUNGER in Africa. xix. ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: The undaunted passion to serve the poor & Marginalised has been the driving force behind the initiatives of the Udbhav Educatuinal & Rural Development Society (R)(UERDS) in its journey of integrated Rural Development Programme comprising of Health,Education,Women Empowerment,Child Rights,Livelihoods and Advocasy for over 3 decades now.Beginning in smaall district in Karnataka way back in 1985,UERDS tody has its presence in all over karnataka Satate.The spirit of dedication and motivation that has been propelling us is all our humble endeavors have lead us to achieve major mile stones during all the years, The challenges and changing dynamics in the current society have made us emerge stronger and orient to stay connected firmly grounded with the principles.we immensely thank over dedicated team and march a head with renewed energy to serve better to the nation.There are diversified projects implementing aiming at comprehensive Primary Health Care,Water Management,livelihood and sustainable development of the people. With a prime objective pf "Reaching un reached"to provide services to the poor in the remote areas with the help of various Goverrrnment Schemes and projects,UERDS has reached nearly one lakh people in Karnataka State through various under taken projects such as:1 Citizen Help Desk,1 Integrated water Management Programme(IWMP),1 Women Help Line,1Self Employment project,3 antenatal Care Project,6 Mobile Health Units,2 Capacity Building Programme for 732 Village Health Sanitation Committees and working as Nodal organisation for vikaspedia portal for Ministry of Communication and Information Technology,Government of India. Further we are poineered and implemented a successful Public Private Partnership (PPP) model that helps leveraging the Govrnments significant investment in public health care,Education and Agriculture by complementing it with a socially committed,not for profit but professionally competent management team to serve underserved.

Rural poor artisans in the field of Integrated Rural Development, in the most backward and interior, drought affected villages.
